title: [Large-scale] Design Thinking-Based Social Studies Innovative Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Educational Methodologies and Social Studies Instructional Experience
context.additional_context: Acquiring interdisciplinary teaching methods for pre-/in-service elementary teachers to apply design thinking in social studies instruction

learning_goals: Develop three lesson plans applying the five stages of design thinking (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test) to social studies problem-solving activities.
Create at least two prototypes using digital/analog tools for learner-centered social studies classes.

After implementing design-thinking-based lessons, learners conduct structured feedback sessions (1/month) with three peer teachers, document and submit an action plan incorporating at least two agreed-upon improvements.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
